# DeviceAnchor

**Structure**

The position and orientation of Apple Vision Pro.

## Declaration

```swift
struct DeviceAnchor
```

## Overview

You create a device anchor by starting an [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARKitSession] with a [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/WorldTrackingProvider] and calling its [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/WorldTrackingProvider/queryDeviceAnchor(atTimestamp:)] method.

## Inspecting a device anchor

- **originFromAnchorTransform**: The transform from the device to the origin coordinate system.
- **trackingState**: Tracking state of this anchor
- **DeviceAnchor.TrackingState**: Values that describe the tracking state of a device anchor.
- **isTracked**: A Boolean value that indicates whether ARKit is tracking the device.
- **description**: A textual representation of this anchor.
- **id**: The unique identifier of this anchor.

## World tracking

- **Tracking specific points in world space**: Retrieve the position and orientation of anchors your app stores in ARKit.
- **WorldTrackingProvider**: A source of live data about the device pose and anchors in a person’s surroundings.
- **WorldAnchor**: A fixed location in a person’s surroundings.

## Conforms To

- Anchor
- CustomStringConvertible
- Identifiable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- TrackableAnchor
